body_html:
@MikeChenfu As @petewarden already said, if you write your graph as a binary file using:

tf.train.write_graph(sess.graph_def, 'tarinGraph', 'train2.pbtxt', as_text=False)

then you will need to pass the --input_binary=true flag to freeze_graph.

Please feel free to re-open this issue if the above solution doesn't work.
body_text:
@MikeChenfu As @petewarden already said, if you write your graph as a binary file using:
tf.train.write_graph(sess.graph_def, 'tarinGraph', 'train2.pbtxt', as_text=False)

then you will need to pass the --input_binary=true flag to freeze_graph.
Please feel free to re-open this issue if the above solution doesn't work.
body:
@MikeChenfu As @petewarden already said, if you write your graph as a binary file using:
```
tf.train.write_graph(sess.graph_def, 'tarinGraph', 'train2.pbtxt', as_text=False)
```
then you will need to pass the `--input_binary=true` flag to `freeze_graph`.

Please feel free to re-open this issue if the above solution doesn't work.
